interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/10/23
Average Rating: 4.9
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tomm Moore'], 'Producers': ['Tomm Moore', 'Ross Murray', 'Paul Young', 'Stéphan Roelants', 'Serge Umé', 'Marc Umé', 'Isabelle Truc', 'Clément Calvet', 'Jérémie Fajner', 'Frederik Villumsen', 'Claus Toksvig Kjaer'], 'Starring': ['David Rawle', 'Brendan Gleeson', 'Fionnula Flannagan']}
Review Text: Sweet little movie based off a celtic legend.  The animation isn't the most cutting edge but the characters are such that you do end up caring about what happens to them.
Review Title: Good family fare and some Celtic thrown in for good measure
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gabrielle Salvatore', 'Ron Cornwall', 'Keith Koslov'], 'Producers': ['Matthew Ostrom', 'Laura Palumbo Johnson', 'Jordan Brodsky', 'Brian Flanagan', 'Dominick Pupa', 'Jonathan Partridge', 'Marni Ellis'], 'Studio': ['TLC']} Decent show if you like this kind of stuff. It was a test to see how the whole prime thing worked. Was new to Prime, {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Zemeckis'], 'Producers': ['Robert Zemeckis', 'Steve Starkey', 'Carl Sagan', 'Ann Druyan'], 'Starring': ['Jodie Foster', 'Matthew McConaughey', 'James Woods']} This movie is one heck of a ride. It will leave you guessing until the end, all the performances are really well done. The special effects are still holding up but are showing their age, but all in all it's a very good story and isn't that what makes a good movie? Worth it! {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Egami'], 'Starring': ['Gabriel Iglesias'], 'Studio': ['Egami']} Stand up comedy at it's finest! Yes there are some "adult" themes but it was very refreshing to watch a entertainer that wasn't dropping a F bomb and words related to it every 5 minutes. Not that I find that kind of language offensive but to have a comedian not rely on those words to be funny... I'll be buying the DVD... Funny, Funny, Funny! {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['KOBUN'], 'Producers': ['Shinsaku Tanaka', 'Ryuji Sekine', 'Hisato Usui', 'Takuro Hatakeyama'], 'Starring': ['Aoi Yuki', 'Daisuke Hirakawa', 'Rie Kugimiya'], 'Studio': ['A-Net Digital']} The animation is different than the majority of the anime out there which is a plus, but since the "censorship" ink splashes detract from the visual which in this case has didn't really impact the storyline but did detract from the flow of the visuals. That is why I gave it the rating I did. Additionally since I am over 21 and live in a locality in which I am not prohibited in the viewing of adult images either of a sexual nature or of a violent nature I find that not having the option of choosing which version to watch rather distasteful Mixed Bag Mythbusters Unscripted, Documentary, Kids, Special Interest ['Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman are at it again--getting to the bottom of popular myths one experiment at a time by combining science, curiosity, and inventiveness. Watch as Adam, Jamie and the rest of the MythBusters team see what really happens when you take candy from a baby, if people really do get cold feet when they are afraid, what happens when poop literally hits the fan and much more in this season of MythBusters.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alice Dallow', 'Lauren Gray Williams', 'Tabitha Lentle', 'Steve Christiansen', 'Peter Rees', 'Andrew Farrell', 'Brian Leckey', 'Rob Hammersley', 'Eric Haven'], 'Producers': ['Linda Wolkovitch']} Mythbusters, what else can I say? Your either a fan or your not. Since I'm a fan.. It's really cool how science and entertainment can come to together in such a way that can be imitated but never replicated Mythbusters.. What else needs to be said? {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brad Bird'], 'Producers': ['Tom Cruise', 'J.J. Abrams', 'Bryan Burk'], 'Starring': ['Tom Cruise', 'Jeremy Renner', 'Simon Pegg'], 'Studio': ['Hit Movies']} This is one of those movies that is a great popcorn flick, but since Brad Bird directed it its a live action comic book Brad Bird, at it again {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Dennis Principe Jr.', 'Julie Auerbach', 'Russell McCarroll', 'Stewart Shields', 'Matthew Ginsburg', 'Gary Auerbach', 'Gail Berman', 'Ron Brody', 'Tina Gazzerro', 'Lloyd Braun'], 'Studio': ['History']} This is basically an anti - conspiracy show which is refreshing out of all the pro-conspiracy type of entertainment out there.
There are some episodes that I feel are a little light on the details but overall a decent show Interesting {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Chris Sanders', 'Stephen C. Harris', 'Daniel Ollek', 'Hudie Ayalon', 'Mark Phillips', 'Eric Anderson', 'Courtney McKenna', 'Jesse Carter Russell', 'Merlin Camozzi', 'Renee Tod'], 'Studio': ['A&E Television Networks']} Who doesn't like a good ghost story? Is very good that it's from real people, the only down side is that it seems like certain people just "give up" in this series and accept the abuse/etc from the ghosts The real deal {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Unavailable'], 'Producers': ['Bellevue Entertainment'], 'Studio': ['Unavailable']} Very nicely produced series, a great deal of very beautiful scenery but there are times it seems like it's a advertisement for the national park service.. Travel anyone? RWBY Barbara Dunkelman (Actor), Kara Eberle (Actor), Monty Oum (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ['Product Description', 'From the creators of smash hit Red vs. Blue comes RWBY, a visually-stunning and hotly anticipated new anime series. A young hero, an exalted heiress, a troubled rogue, and a party girl… These are the four members of RWBY, a team brought together and trained for the sole purpose of combating the rampant evils that plague the fantastic world of Remnant.', 'Amazon.com', 'RWBY', "(2013) is an anime-styled American web series from Rooster Teeth Studio; its title comes from the initials of the four main characters: Ruby, Weiss, Blake, and Yang. Ruby Rose is an eager, weapon-wielding 15-year-old who's about to enter the Beacon Academy to train to become a huntress, a warrior who fights the evils that plague the world of Remnant. She's put on a team with three other standard-issue young women: spoiled, self-assured Weiss Schnee; intellectual Blake Belladonna, who hides a dark past; and enthusiastic, supportive Yang Xiao Long. The uneasy quartet and their friends from other teams are soon training to handle weapons, carry out missions, slay monsters, and function as a team. As", 'RWBY', 'was created for the web on an obviously limited budget, the animation and designs are minimal at best. Secondary characters appear as black silhouettes and important actions often take place off camera or behind a screen of dust. The episodes only last 16 minutes, including the opening and closing titles, which may be a more awkward length to direct than the standard half-hour. Sometimes too much action is crowded into too short a space; other episodes end before the story reaches a satisfactory conclusion. But the biggest problem with', 'RWBY', 'isn\'t the minimal animation or erratic storytelling, but an utter lack of originality. Although director-cowriter Monty Oum begins his commentary talking about "stories I always wanted to tell," he and cowriters Miles Luna and Kerry Shawcross borrow pretty much everything from various anime', 'shojo', 'adventures, boarding school training series, and adventure quests, including', 'Naruto', 'and', 'Fairy Tail', '. Like', 'Avatar: The Last Airbender', ',', 'RWBY', 'was created by American artists trying to capture the excitement and appeal of Japanese animation--but with notably less success. (Not rated; suitable for ages 10 and older: cartoon violence, violence against women, tobacco use)', '--Charles Solomon'] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.92 Ounces', 'Item model number': '28928786', 'Director': 'Monty Oum', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Blu-ray, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 50 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 12, 2013', 'Actors': 'Barbara Dunkelman, Kara Eberle, Lindsay Tuggey, Arryn Zech', 'Studio': 'Cinedigm', 'Number of discs': '1'} If I have to explain it, then you probably wouldn't understand. But seriously, the music and story line are such that it's a really good story with character development along the way. There are some minor things that some people would find problematic but the animation is pretty good considering, RWBY, what can I say? {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Don Hall', 'Chris Williams'], 'Producers': ['Roy Conli'], 'Starring': ['T.J. Miller', 'Jamie Chung', 'Maya Rudolph'], 'Studio': ['WALT DISNEY PICTURES']} Pixar had rubbed off on Disney! This really reminds me of a Pixar film, good characters that have depth to them, an interesting take on the whole good guy / bad guy dynamic that is a nice surprise. I rented this to just to see if I wanted to purchase this, and yeah, I will buy the bluray Good Movie {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Shawn Levy'], 'Producers': ['Shawn Levy', 'Chris Columbus', 'Mark Radcliffe'], 'Starring': ['Ben Stiller', 'Steve Coogan', 'Ricky Gervais'], 'Studio': ['Fox']} Same old story except that this was a set up from the beginning to get this series over and done with.. Thank goodness.. If you have ever seen the other ones.. you know what is going to happen through most of the film. Tired and more tired {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ron Howard'], 'Producers': ['Brian Grazer'], 'Starring': ['Tom Hanks', 'Daryl Hannah', 'Eugene Levy']} Oldie but a goodie. Worth a watch for us when feeling nostalgic for the 80's.. worth the price of rental {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Steven Suderman'], 'Producers': ['Steven Suderman'], 'Studio': ['FilmBuff']} I thought that this would be about what was going on in America with the organic, small farms but instead this was about small farms in Canada. I know that there are some things in common however there is a big difference in the economic landscape between the two countries. It does bring home some of the aspects of farming .. Eh, not bad {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Bobby Sheehan'], 'Producers': ['Bobby Sheehan'], 'Starring': ['Alanah Rafferty'], 'Studio': ['FilmBuff']} This is not a film that you should watch if you believe in the cult of allopathy. In fact, this should cause you to have some hard questions for your health care provider. Is unfortunate that we as a culture have abdicated our responsibility for our own health and welfare to the people in white coats.. Be aware, this could upset you {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tomm Moore'], 'Producers': ['Tomm Moore', 'Ross Murray', 'Paul Young', 'Stéphan Roelants', 'Serge Umé', 'Marc Umé', 'Isabelle Truc', 'Clément Calvet', 'Jérémie Fajner', 'Frederik Villumsen', 'Claus Toksvig Kjaer'], 'Starring': ['David Rawle', 'Brendan Gleeson', 'Fionnula Flannagan']} Sweet little movie based off a celtic legend. The animation isn't the most cutting edge but the characters are such that you do end up caring about what happens to them. Good family fare and some Celtic thrown in for good measure
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user maintains a strong enjoyment for TV shows and documentaries about real-life ghost stories, unique animations, and educational stand-up comedy. They appreciate deep storytelling and character development while remaining critical of repetitive themes within familiar series. Their recent engagement with a Celtic-themed animated film highlights a continued interest in narratives that evoke emotional investment despite simplicity in animation.

- **Language & Accessibility:** Their preference for English-language content with subtitles and audio descriptions remains firm for inclusivity. However, they are receptive to select non-subtitled materials that resonate with their interests, as seen in their recent review.

- **Ratings Trends:** The user’s average ratings have reached 4.7, reflecting a discerning taste. They provided a thoughtful 4.0 rating on a family-oriented film that emphasized plot and character connection over technical excellence, showing their capacity to appreciate content that fosters personal engagement despite lacking advanced animation.

- **Engagement Level:** Actively engaging with innovative animations and stand-up comedy, the user values character-driven narratives enriched by music. They balance nostalgia with critical appraisal of contemporary works, exhibiting a keen ability to navigate the complexities of narrative predictability.

- **Cautious Explorer:** Emphasizing sophisticated humor and mature themes, they express concerns about censorship, seeking narratives that prioritize originality and depth. Their consumption reflects a discerning viewer who aims for artistic integrity and meaningful storytelling.

In summary, the user is a critical yet engaged viewer seeking depth and creativity while navigating content quality and thematic relevance.
